oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Level Stress recordings: Älvdalen_90
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kristoffersen, Gjert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Phonology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Recording equipment The recordings were done by means of a cassette recorder (Sony TC-D5M) and Sony lavaliere microphones. They were digitized in the 1990s. The set consists of two speakers, father and grown-up daughter. The original full recordings have been lost, and they are therefore reconstructed from a series of single files saved into one wav file.
The speakers The two speakers, born in 1921 and 1944, were recruited with the help of the Swedish linguist Gunnar Nyström, who has a thorough knowledge of Dalarna and the Dalarna dialects. At the time of recording, they lived in the villages of Karlsarvet and Brunnsberg. A third speaker was also recorded, a man born in 1921, but due to his weak voice, extremely non-fluent reading and background noise generated by some technical failure, this recording has not been included in the collection.
For the full background description of this item, see the file "Älvdalen_90: Background.pdf".
For the full description of the whole project, see these files: The Level Stress recordings.pdf LevelStress_Glossary.pdf Level Stress_Speaker and Sound File Codes.pdf
The data should be used only for research and development purposes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: University of Bergen, Department of Linguistic, Literary and Aesthetic Studies
